messages.content: The choice you make in the General Election on May 7th will have major consequences for people here in Lancaster.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Freeze NHS prescription charges until 2017, provide 25 hours free childcare a week for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds, recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs for our NHS.
Labour will clear the deficit but we will not make these further cuts to vital services.

issues.economy: Labour will clear the deficit but we will not make these further extreme cuts to vital services.
issues.education: Provide 25 hours free childcare a week for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds
issues.environment: Cat Smith strongly opposes unsafe and environmentally damaging fracking.
issues.health: Freeze NHS prescription charges until 2017, recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs for our NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Provide 25 hours free childcare a week for working parents of 3 and 4 year olds

leaflet.personalStatement: I know people are rightly concerned about their future, and the future of their children. Those who work hard and play by the rules shouldn't have to worry about paying the bills and making ends meet. You shouldn't have to worry that your children won't get the opportunities they deserve.

images.caption: Cat Smith with constituents and campaigning imagery
